vocabulary.definition: in an admirably purposeful, determined, and unwavering manner
vocabulary.example: She resolutely refused to give up on her dreams despite facing numerous challenges.

vocabulary.definition: in a way that is impossible or very difficult to correct, reform, or control
vocabulary.example: He remained incorrigibly lazy, no matter how many times he was warned about it.

vocabulary.definition: involving or requiring strenuous effort; difficult and tiring
vocabulary.example: The climb to the mountain peak was arduous but rewarding.

vocabulary.definition: difficult situations or problems that require a choice between options that are equally undesirable or mutually exclusive
vocabulary.example: She was faced with the dilemma of choosing between her career and her passion for travel.

vocabulary.definition: a situation in which no progress is possible, especially because of disagreement; a deadlock
vocabulary.example: The negotiations reached an impasse when neither party was willing to compromise.

vocabulary.definition: to develop over a period of time; to conceive and gradually develop an idea or plan
vocabulary.example: The idea for the new marketing campaign began to gestate during a brainstorming session.
